all raw means is that it stores a lot more data in the image taking photos as jpegs is fine you are just throwing away some detail to save a lot of space as a simplification think of it like instead of having shades of red itll compress that down to shades moving each red pixel that is being compressed closer to the next nearest shade so raw doesnt mean that it is better quality it just gives you more control over the final images exact look as you are editing it this can include preserving more of the dynamic range of the image but it doesnt necessarily mean it supports being shown on a hdr display any better

in the paradigm of aigenerated content aigc there has been increasing attention in extending pretrained texttoimage t2i models to texttovideo t2v generation despite their effectiveness these frameworks face challenges in maintaining consistent narratives and handling rapid shifts in scene composition or object placement from a single user prompt this paper introduces a new framework dubbed direct2v which leverages instructiontuned large language models llms to generate framebyframe descriptions from a single abstract user prompt direct2v utilizes llm directors to divide user inputs into separate prompts for each frame enabling the inclusion of timevarying content and facilitating consistent generation to maintain temporal consistency and prevent object collapse we propose a novel value mapping method and dualsoftmax filtering extensive experimental results validate the effectiveness of the direct2v framework in producing visually coherent and consistent from abstract user prompts addressing the challenges of zeroshot generation the code and demo will be publicly available abstract explained by chatgpt this text is about a new way that computers are learning to create from written instructions its called direct2v and it helps to make sure that the made by a computer stay consistent and dont have errors the computer uses large language models to understand the written instructions and turn them into a series of pictures or frames that are put together to make a the program also has ways of adjusting the pictures and the timing so that everything stays in order and looks like it makes sense this new method has been tested and proven to work well and the creators will make their code available for others to use

apparently reddit has a hidden character limit oh well i wrote in the previous part in this series on the isolation and loneliness i experienced as a result of being homeschooled the limited opportunities for socialization was made up for with an encouragement of extracurricular learning since an early age i was taught how to teach myself utilizing the library system internet forums and pirated software i became skilled in photoshop 3d modeling music and eventually balloons balloon twisting was a skill taught to me at the age of by my parents many excult members have negative feelings about balloons due to its association with the cult but i value the connection as the convenient illustration of the unique circumstances throughout my family history that led to me being the person i am today a history tracing back to my great grandfather david berg who got his start preaching to wayward hippies at huntington beach in the late 60s as well intentioned as the group may have started out the radical views on sex that grandpa developed when combined with the all encompassing authoritarian nature of the cult he created led to some truly stomach churning abuses i was shielded by abuse in part due to the careful parenting of my parents and due to the doctrinal overhauls that took place in previous generations after much international backlash and public scrutiny a story of institutionalized abuse coverup reform and gaslighting that i uncovered piece by piece as i was given more freedom to read the cults antiquated teachings david berg kept his likeness hidden for much of the cults existence in order to evade consequences for the abuses he perpetrated and made commonplace only after his passing did the cult release a photo book so his many thousands of followers could finally know the leader theyd been so dedicated to when in hiding his appearance was substituted with a friendly and wise old anthropomorphic lion character this is the lion i would render in balloon form to burn the man in effigy mixing both crucifixion and hereticatthestake imagery a fitting end to such a selfstyled rebel prophet out of his disemboweled corpse flows honey like honey from the lions carcass that samson would construct his riddle around the honey meets with a hexagonal honeycomb pattern composed entirely of classic balloon dogs the iconographic symbol of balloon art connecting my familys past in the cult with the medium i sculpt with today the large x foot painting that makes up the background is a more abstract form of the sculptures themes of beauty and goodness derived from chaos and despair the various textures are created using many different techniques and acrylic mediums palette knives piping bags and custom hexagon silicone molds were used with modeling paste acrylic gels and crackle paste to evoke the gore and viscera of a decaying corpse alongside the life and structure of a buzzing beehive working on a project over both the long and short term with paintings that take months and balloon sculptures that take days puts in perspective the complexity of understanding someones story to truly understand someone you need to take in both their immediate lived and felt experiences and the sometimes long and complicated history and context within which those events take place creating this balloon sculpture for display while also setting up the rest of my exhibition posed more of a challenge than if i were to have worked solely in private but it all came together and im glad so many people got a chance to see it in person there will be one final balloon sculpturepainting part in the series but ill be taking my time with it and setting up an event sometime in the future for its exhibition maybe as part of a group show well see

i used to think that way too but theres an important distinction generative ai doesnt work with the original pixels or bits of data instead it creates new from scratch during training it gradually denoises a noisy image to match an example from the dataset and saves the learned parameters into its model weights when generating new picture it starts with a noisy image and denoises it according to the prompt and learnt parameters producing new image rather than just remixing existing data and dont get me wrong i dont justify training on copyrighted content there are just some misconceptions about how it works

the reason that people use a lot of these is because of anime checkpoints most anime checkpoints are based off of naianythingv3 those versions were trained using danbooru tags and thats why people use masterpiece best quality as these are quality tags on danbooru those two were not trained by picking a subset of the best images but rather they basically just scraped anything they could find because they thought more databetter model however that lowered the average quality of the model so using tags that denote the best images on danbooru in fact improve overall image quality however as people realize that better quality data is more important than the amount of data the average image generated by newer checkpoints has become far higher quality what that means is for the most part a lot of the newer anime models do not strictly need those tags though they do still improve the quality on some of the older ones anyway a lot of general stable diffusion checkpoints also adopted the danbooru method of prompting even if not necessarily trained on it in part due to the simple fact that thats what people are used to there are some tags that actually make a difference due to their concepts like ray tracing subsurface scattering bokeh etc these are generally not danbooru tags however with sdxl this has changed because the general quality of images used to train the base model has changed and people making new checkpoints usually only train on the best images though pony is an exception heres to praying that with sd3 we finally see the end of all of these prompt tags

i think we need to emphasize the there are certainly categories of photography where a dslr will shine a lot more yeah maybe though ive always found the technical stuff quite easy to learn and i struggle more with composition and working with people ive met plenty people with great gear that produce uninspiring photos some days im one of them there was definitely a time when the primary hurdle to becoming a good photographer was mastering the gear film and maybe chemistry you could make a decent living cranking out routine portraits or shooting for local newspapers these days the bar for technical competency is pretty much gone and someone who takes great photos with a smartphone will almost certainly with comparatively little training be able to take even better ones with a dslr and really who downvoted my original post

i had a imac with 24gb ram and 2tb hdd i replaced it with a macbook pro with m1 pro chip 16gb ram and 1tb ssd even with less memory performance is about the same as the imac was i wish i had gone for the 32gb model though youll need an external monitor if you go the macbook route for i could get a refurbished m2 mini with gb ram and a tb ssd for you can get a new m2 mini with 24gb ram and a 1tb ssd this is what i would do unless you think 1tb isnt enough the 24gb option did not exist with the m1 models at the time i bought my macbook otherwise thats what i would have chosen apple charges an extra to go up to 2tb you can get a 10tb external hdd for half that price would the extra cp in the studio be useful it would be most noticeable when exporting pictures the extra ports compared to the mini are probably more useful than that extra processing power

hi and thank you for taking the time to reply so thoughtfully and at length im right with you on manual focusing and especially on filters and safety which you had no way of knowing so im grateful for your taking care just in case your experience regarding image quality and diffraction at f with the tc is exactly what i was hoping to learn thanks if im one stop or one tc power away from visible diffraction ill take it that im okay but just inside the boundary of okay what remains for me to determine is how much of my available magnifying power i actually want to use the effective 1050mm with the 500mm crop factor tc will give me a sunmoon that occupy about percent of the frame horizontally thanks to jubier i know my max exposure time wo tracking may be as short as sec to avoid motion blur per espenak at iso and f thats good for corona out to one solar radius without the tc at an effective 750mm and all else above the same looking at a smaller apparent disc jubier gives me seconds max exposure and that gives me corona out to somewhere between and solar radii according to espenak so do i want lots of groovy corona or max closeup on bailys beads etc do i have the guts to try mounting or demounting the tc during the of totality ill have at my location or will i remain locked in if i simply leave the tc on and back the zoom out i guess well see if it isnt cloudy in austin thanks again for being so responsive and thoughful

i think the main takeaway from your post is that we should definitely be looking at canon over anything else well im a canonshooter so take that with a grain of salt most shooters think their own brand of camera is superior but if you want a lowcost recentmodel camera canon might make that easier to find that doesnt necessarily mean its a better choice sony might be worth it simply to avoid mount system switchover hassle in the future if we wanted to invest in a model released years ago how much would we need to increase the budget by and what model numbers should we be on the look out for this is just me but these types of camera systems are very expensive no matter which way you slice it because the lenses are interchangeable and that means multiple lenses the lenses are the main expense because if you stick with a mount system those stay with you through the camera body upgrades so getting a year old entrylevel camera so you can afford lenses actually isnt a bad idea particularly if you want to control costs im making an assumption here but if canon has a major share in the market that a lot of the third party lenses with be compatible with any of these older cameras or have some way to adapt them to fit the camera body yes you can adapt canons own and 3rdparty efefs mount dslr lenses to the newer eos r mirrorless mount if needed its just that getting an r mount body at this time is at least and a lens adapter will probably be another then theres the lens being an older optical design and possibly bulkier than a mirrorless design might so for the budget you were looking at sticking with dslr until a newe advanced camera is needed is one option these older cameras all use the ef mount yes efefs the ef lenses are for full frame bodies with larger sensors the efs lenses are for crop bodies with smaller apscsized sensors the size of the sensor also affects the price of the camera while crop bodies can come new in the range full frame bodies are generally in the range while new but a crop body can use both ef and efs lenses the main distinction between the two types of lenses is how big a sensor the image circle the lens projects can cover an ef lens can cover both sizes an efs lens can only cover a crop sensor the website im reading also says canon has an efs mount would these lenses work with the older models of camera or are they for the more recent ones only the ef and efs lenses are for the older dslrs the rf and rfs lenses are for the newcurrent mirrorless the efm i know are for the older eos m mirrorless system which most of us predict is going to be discontinued now that the r50 seems to be a replacement for the m50 ii regarding lense brands is it better to go with canon ones or a third party such as sigma is there such a thing as a better lense yes but sometimes it can be overkill particularly on a budget whats better and whats sufficient may be two different things 3rd party lenses can be great they can be worse but far less expensive or they can fill a hole in the canon oem lineup eg the sigma dc 30mm f has no equivalent efs counterpart so theres no clearcut definitive answer of whats going to be the best fit for your daughters use pattern but i would say for a dslr an kit lens is not a bad way to start though its thoroughly denigated on most online discussions of lenses its cheap its versatile and its an easy way to build up lens experience to figure out what your next lens should be the typical training wheels triple as i call it would be an efs an efs is stm and the ef 50mm f stm regarding mpb and their listings how important is it to take note of the shutter count figure listed underneath each camera advertisement is there a need to select the camera with the lowest figure or does it not really matter does a higher figure indicate something failure of the shutter apart from the previous owner used the camera a lot its just a usage figure think of it like mileage on a used car most dslr camera shutterbox mechanisms are rated for actuations some survive multiples of that before needing a replacement some fail before but roughly speaking if the number is much higher than year that would indicate heavy usage probably professional just as with car mileage

i could imagine theoretically if you pushed the image stops the z6 having a slight amount of some sort of pattern noise that a full frame dslr wouldnt have because essentially being in live view all the time will build up a little more heat in the sensor that leads to slightly noisier shadows the d7500 is apsc though and id be very surprised if it is cleaner in the shadows than the z6 and this able to be pushed more or maybe depending on how the raw is demosaiced and processed there are artifacts from the z6s strips of pixels dedicated to onsensor phase detect i havent seen or heard of this actually happening but there are pixels masked off to be used for the autofocus

i have a pc i built as a nas recently upgraded it to 4x8tb drives in raid this gives me 24tb of storage as you lose one hdd to parity data but means a hdd can fail without data being lost this hot copies to an external 22tb drive overnight and does a full sync end of the week so i have a local recovery for any data i may accidentally delete within a week the 2tb smaller is just they didnt do a 24tb drive at a reasonable price figure by the time i get to needing the capacity one will be available to swap out to everything is then backed up to a cloud storage service backblaze which is ridiculously cheap for unlimited data backups and can order a drive with all the data on them in absolute worse case i need to recover everything and quickly rather than waiting for however long it takes to download the 12tb i have with them currently the service also has a year of file versioning to help against bit rot if a file is corrupted i have a year with which to notice and grab a tier on my uk account limited on my aus account so your location may vary which i view as a free extra precaution given im already paying for prime for other reasons id like to upgrade to a better subjects are uncomfortable in front of the camera dont want to get their picture taken in the first place this is true for most people whether it be corporate headshots family portraits or bridals before a wedding the company has to invest a notsmall chunk of working hours this is true for one employee who may be helping to coordinate everyone having their picture taken should just be a few minutes each if this is done on site clients dont like their pictures and want a reshoot i shoot tethered to a laptop i shoot or so shots then i let you see your hair smile tilt of your head that necklace you werent sure about we talk about it for a few seconds make adjustments then shoot more you pick your shot before you walk away there are no reshoots locations are not optimal for lighting this can be true i have one client who only wants shallow depth of field shots with the employees work area blurred in the background the lighting is often bad this is why i bring lights and modifiers also corporate headshots look always more or less the same clean professional confident strong retouch not really much personality mine are more dirty and natural always in the work environment or outside and never the traditional light shot on a headshot background with deep fake methods like latent diffusion you could train a model for a subject in a short period of time using like selfies and then create all the corporate headshots you need you could also adjust posture facial expressions good smile also for camera shy people clothes etc a good photographer is already doing this my main point is that the client has effectively work except getting selfies of each subject and then the corporate headshots can be taken some people may switch to this many will not

i recommend the ipad air model with the m1 chip and 256gb storage i spent so long debating if i should go with a higher or lower end ipad but the air is a pretty strong balance biggest thing is it supports the apple pencil at the best value price point the cheaper normal ipad are okay if youre really sticking to a lower budget but only support the apple pencil the air has a better screen along with the wireless pencil charging the pro gets you a bigger screen and more storage for honestly too much extra money if you dont know that you need the extra screen space you probably dont need it yet and youre better off using either a cloud or external storage solution if you really need 1tb of storage 256gb is plenty of working space and i would always recommend backups of your art on a different storage space anyways you wouldnt want everything to suddenly disappear especially since the ipad probably wont stay in a single safe spot at all times

its worth noting that something to look out for at least with illustrator is that many even basic things that should be handled by nonrasterised methods like filters end up just being stored as rasterised images when you export as an svg as well as internally hence why ai filesizes can often balloon in size so exporting what you think is a vector as an svg can actually end up bigger than just exporting it as a flat rasterised image since then there isnt dozens of embedded images for each of the effects and since the effects are just rasterised images anyway doing it as a flat image avoids the problem of having weird scaling issues
